intro: Peponium adpressipilosum, commonly known as the woolly pumpkin, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, melons, and gourds. The plant is characterized by its hairy, sprawling vines and large, lobed leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a large, round pumpkin-like structure that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter.
